hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.examples.jobhistoryprocessor

Class MultiIaaSJobDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.Timed
      • hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.examples.jobhistoryprocessor.MultiIaaSJobDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.Timed>

    public class MultiIaaSJobDispatcher
extends hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.Timed
    A simple trace processor that creates as many VMs in the cloud as many is required to host single jobs (e.g., if the job requires 1024 processors then it will create 16 VMs with 64 cores if the PM with the largest size in the cloud could host 64 core VMs). After the VMs are created the jobs are sent to them. After the jobs terminate their hosting VMs are also terminated. The VMIs for the VMs are assumed to be capable of running all the jobs in the trace.
    Author:
    "Gabor Kecskemeti, Laboratory of Parallel and Distributed Systems, MTA SZTAKI (c) 2012-5"

      protected hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.io.VirtualAppliance va

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiIaaSJobDispatcher

        public MultiIaaSJobDispatcher(hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.helpers.trace.GenericTraceProducer producer,
                      List<hu.mta.sztaki.lpds.cloud.simulator.iaas.IaaSService> target)
        Dispatcher setup. Fetches all jobs from the given trace producer and analyzes them to fill out min- and max-submit-times. Finally it analyzes and prepares the target IaaS services. The analysis is targeted at finding the PM capacity characteristics of each IaaS, while the preparatory step ensures the availability of the VA to be used for instantiating the VMs for the jobs. WARNING: only uniformly prepared IaaS systems are supported right now (i.e. all of them having the same amount of PMs and all of their PMs are constructed with the same amount of resources)
        Parameters:
        producer - the trace
        target - the iaas systems to be used for submitting the trace to
